title: Migrate game design from v1 experiment
description:
Migrate the game design artifacts and decisions from the v1 experiment repo into this repo so future work is centralized and auditable.

Scope:
- Inventory existing v1 design artifacts (GDD, sketches, notes, TODOs)
- Decide what becomes the new baseline vs archived history
- Import/port selected artifacts into docs/dev (and/or new agreed locations)
- Record any missing context as explicit open questions

Acceptance:
- A clear ‘source of truth’ design doc exists in this repo
- Links back to v1 sources are preserved for traceability
- Any gaps are captured as bd issues linked to this epic

title: Design and document game development with AI team
description:
Define and document an AI-led game development workflow for this repo so work stays aligned, reviewable, and repeatable.

Deliverables:
- Team model (human roles + agent roles) and RACI
- End-to-end workflow (issue → branch → PR → merge → close) using bd
- Reusable templates (notably the GDD template) and where they live
- Tooling/quality gates guidance (tests, reviews, doc checks)

Acceptance:
- docs/dev/team.md and docs/dev/workflow.md describe the agreed process
- Templates are referenced from the workflow and are usable end-to-end
- Subtasks cover remaining work with clear owners and dependencies

title: Define AI team roles and RACI
description: List AI/human roles (design lead, gameplay, art, QA), decision boundaries, and review responsibilities.

title: Document AI-assisted workflow and cadence
description:
Document the day-to-day workflow and cadence for AI-assisted development in this repo.

Include:
- How work is selected (bd ready/stale), claimed, and tracked
- Branch + PR workflow, including how PR URLs and summaries are logged back to bd
- Review cadence and what gets reviewed (code, docs, tests)
- Logging expectations (decisions, risks, open questions)
- Definition of Done for doc-only vs code changes

Acceptance:
- docs/dev/workflow.md is complete, readable, and matches how we actually work
- All commands referenced are valid bd/git commands
- The workflow explicitly references the GDD template when design changes occur

comments.author: rgardler
comments.text:
Review notes for GEngine-p4p.2 (workflow/cadence) after reading AGENTS.md + docs/dev/workflow.md:

1) Align bd sync guidance with reality
- docs/dev/workflow.md Step 5 says “use bd sync … before each commit”. In practice, full `bd sync` performs git operations (commit/pull/push) and can fail when no remote is configured.
- Recommend changing Step 5 to: run `bd sync --flush-only` before commits (or rely on the pre-commit hook), and reserve full `bd sync` for end-of-session / multi-device sync.
- Optional: mention `bd sync --no-pull --no-push` for “local-only” situations.

2) Make remote requirements explicit (both docs)
- docs/dev/workflow.md assumes `origin` exists (`git push -u origin ...`), but the repo can be in a state with no remotes configured.
- Recommend adding a short pre-step: “Verify remote exists: `git remote -v`”, and if missing, set it from `$REPO_URL`.
- Add env var `REMOTE_NAME="origin"` (or adjust commands to use `$REMOTE_NAME`).

3) Standardize on BD_ACTOR vs AGENT_NAME
- docs/dev/workflow.md defines `AGENT_NAME` but bd’s audit identity is `$BD_ACTOR` / `--actor`.
- Recommend replacing/augmenting `AGENT_NAME` with `BD_ACTOR` in workflow.md’s environment section (and optionally referencing it in AGENTS.md quick reference).

4) Tighten “executable doc” consistency
- The workflow doc structure is good (Intro/Prereqs/Env/Steps/Summary/Next Steps). A few small tweaks would make it more “executable”:
  - The env var descriptions say “append _${HASH}” but the defaults already include _${HASH} (WORKTREE_ROOT, BRANCH_NAME). Recommend rewording to avoid confusion.
  - Consider adding `BASE_BRANCH="master"` (or main) to avoid implicit base-branch assumptions.

5) Reduce duplication + cross-link
- AGENTS.md contains a “Landing the plane” block that mandates `git pull --rebase; bd sync; git push`.
- Recommend cross-linking to docs/dev/workflow.md and adjusting the “push is mandatory” language to be conditional: “if a remote is configured”. Otherwise specify what “done” means for a local-only repo (commit locally; add remote later).

6) Minor edits (low priority)
- AGENTS.md typos: “informaiton”, “chosen own” → “chosen owner”.

If you want, I can turn these into concrete doc edits in a PR once the desired default remote/base-branch is confirmed.

comments.author: rgardler
comments.text: Implemented the recommendations in docs: updated docs/dev/workflow.md to use BD_ACTOR/REMOTE_NAME/BASE_BRANCH, added explicit remote verification, and switched per-commit guidance to bd sync --flush-only; updated AGENTS.md to make push-to-remote conditional on a configured remote and fixed typos. Commit: 63fef2c.

title: Game design doc template and outline
description:
Produce a Game Design Document template that’s optimized for AI collaboration and Producer sign-off.

Include:
- A clear sectioning that separates facts, assumptions, options, and decisions
- Explicit ‘Producer decision’ markers where human approval is required
- Guidance for agents on what to ask when information is missing
- Acceptance criteria and ‘Definition of Done’ for designs

Acceptance:
- Template exists at docs/dev/gdd-template.md
- The workflow doc references it for any design-affecting change
- It’s usable to generate a complete GDD without inventing missing requirements

title: Tooling and quality gates for AI team
description:
Define the repo tooling expectations and quality gates that keep AI-generated changes safe and reviewable.

Cover:
- Branching conventions and PR requirements
- What must be logged to bd (branch name, PR URL, final summary)
- Automated checks: formatting/linting/tests/build (what exists now vs what we’ll add)
- Review rules: when Producer review is required vs agent-only review
- Where templates and prompts live (docs/dev, history/, etc.)

Acceptance:
- The workflow doc references these gates and they are actionable
- Any missing tooling is captured as follow-up bd issues (with priorities)
- The process is compatible with bd hooks and JSONL sync

comments.author: rgardler
comments.text: Implemented tooling and quality gates: added docs/dev/tooling-and-quality-gates.md, wired it into docs/dev/workflow.md and docs/dev/team.md, and created follow-up issues GEngine-p4p.7 and GEngine-p4p.8 for concrete test/lint/build commands and CI. See commit 0cb1043.

title: Install Perles tooling
description: Install and verify Perles from https://github.com/SorraTheOrc/perles; document setup steps and ensure availability for workflow definition work.

title: Create prompt for GDD creation
description:
Create a reusable, copy/paste prompt that generates a complete Game Design Document using docs/dev/gdd-template.md.

The prompt must instruct agents to:
- Ask targeted questions to fill missing information (max ~10 at a time)
- Offer 2–3 plausible options with explicit tradeoffs for any ambiguous areas
- Clearly separate ‘Producer decisions’ from ‘AI draft content’
- Produce output in the exact structure of the template
- Log the result back to the bd issue (link to the committed GDD/PR URL) via bd comments

Acceptance:
- Prompt can be used by Producer/Prompt Engineer to reliably produce a filled GDD
- Output aligns to docs/dev/gdd-template.md headings and intent
- The prompt includes instructions for bd logging (branch + PR URL + summary)

title: Define baseline test/lint/build commands
description: Define project-standard TEST_CMD, LINT_CMD, FORMAT_CMD, and BUILD_CMD values used in docs/dev/tooling-and-quality-gates.md, wire them into the actual toolchain (once chosen), and document how to run them locally and in CI.

title: Introduce CI pipeline enforcing quality gates
description: Set up a CI pipeline (e.g., GitHub Actions) that runs TEST_CMD, LINT_CMD, FORMAT_CMD, and BUILD_CMD for every PR, verifies bd sync state where appropriate, and reports results back to the PR.
